body: @ItsMeLarry : Thanks for opening the issue!  Do you mind explaining more what you're trying to do, and if possible, share any relevant code?

This looks like maybe an errant issue given it's just the template (?)

Closing as a result though feel free to reopen if there is actually something awry

Something is wrong someplace.  I have other things to do right now, but
will provide info requested by gfyoung.  Simply, the code I used to
download from FBI UCR space, as well as other code, failed when I attempted
same thing from Github.  I'm sure it is something about my own space in
Github, but I am clueless at the moment.  Will be back later today.
Larry

On Fri, Mar 1, 2019 at 12:40 PM William Ayd <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> This looks like maybe an errant issue given it's just the template (?)
>
> Closing as a result though feel free to reopen if there is actually
> something awry
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/25489#issuecomment-468748021>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ArPZQirdcU6d5JeP_btRmjQSkvEe8buvks5vSWYKgaJpZM4bX9rn>
> .
>

I successfully downloaded a number of xls files from FBI site, then ran into trouble trying to download from Github.  A little more background: I needed data from Census, but couldn't find place to copy URLs for files, so did their auto-download to my desktop, then uploaded from my desktop to Github.  Couldn't load into Jupyter Notebook from desktop directly because of another issue about Jupyter acting like it was partitioning my disk.  That's another problem I'm pursuing.  Also, this file, 'five.xls', is a sample I created to troubleshoot this problem.  Cell A1 has "Five" in it and cell A2 has a 5; nothing else.  I've tried dowloading this file in csv, xlsx and xls formats.  Below is the xls approach, same format as FBI files. So, here's the code:

dls = "https://github.com/ItsMeLarry/Coursera_Capstone/blob/master/five.xls"
resp = requests.get(dls)
output = open('five.xls', 'wb')
output.write(resp.content)
chkthis=pd.read_excel('five.xls',sheet_name=0,index_col=False)
chkthis.head()

The error message:
XLRDError: Unsupported format, or corrupt file: Expected BOF record; found b'\n\n\n\n\n\n<!'

Good luck.  And thanks.

You probably want the "raw" link for binaries from Github:
https://github.com/ItsMeLarry/Coursera_Capstone/blob/master/five.xls?raw=true

FYI, we usually steer usage questions to StackOverflow since search engines
typically find them better than GitHub issues (which we use for bug reports
/ feature requests).

Aha!!!  I just got it to work!  Do the Ctl-Click and copy at the 'download' button on 'Read Raw' page, and get the URL that works.  The difference is directory "Raw" instead of "blob".  Frabjous Day!

Neva mind.
